message.content:
cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.AR, cs.SY, cs.NI. 

This paper discusses the performance and system aspects of using erasure coding in large-scale distributed storage systems with SSD arrays. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). The paper also evaluates the system with a popular open-source distributed parallel file system, which suggests cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) as another likely category. The analysis of network traffic and physical data layout may fall under cs.AR (Hardware Architecture) and cs.SY (Systems and Control), respectively. Finally, the paper collects block-level traces, which could be useful for researchers in the field of cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture).
